ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] How much will you pay to play?
ygData.msgSnippet: And Druzzil RO too. COOL I play: Miali 13 Ranger Hallucian 16 Mage Fahzel 16 Druid See ya around ...    hehe i
ygData.messageBody:
And Druzzil RO too.
COOL

I play:

Miali 13 Ranger
Hallucian 16 Mage
Fahzel 16 Druid

See ya around

--- ian johnstone <ikestarwolf@...> wrote:

<HR>
<html>

<div style='background-color:'><DIV>
<P>hehe i dont even dare to think how much i spent on
GW stuff in the last 13 years :( hell in the last 10
years even :( use to be ok at 40p a figure but now
they milking everyone real bad, anyway</P>
<P>as far as evequest is concerned the monthly charge
was and is secondry to lag, and playability, i spent
about a month trying out all the other mmporgs that
were out such as UO, AC, and that silly sci-fi one
which i thought suked real bad anyway. but i found
them all to be overly complicated or laggy.</P>
<P>i choose eq because me and my family are able to
play at the same time sharing the same 56k connection
without any probs, although we do use state of the art
machines being constantly upgraded, although no
ge-force 4 yet, (only the foolish would throw away 300
on a geforce card just now, when they will be 200 ina
few months).</P>
<P>back to the point: i think that the $12 or so that
it costs is ok just now, even taking into account the
3 accounts we have, but if it went up to $20 or so i
think that would be to much, allowing for the exchange
rate i pay about ï¿½8-9 per account after the $12
increase.</P>
<P>Nuada <Knights In Arms><BR>Elven
Mage<BR>Druzil RO</P></DIV>>From: Rob LeBeau
<RLEBEAU65@...>
<DIV></DIV>>Reply-To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
<DIV></DIV>>To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
<DIV></DIV>>Subject: Re: [EverQuest] How much will
you pay to play?
<DIV></DIV>>Date: Wed, 1 May 2002 06:16:37 -0700
(PDT)
<DIV></DIV>>
<DIV></DIV>>A fellow GW player........NICE
<DIV></DIV>>OH BOY do I know how you feel there.
<DIV></DIV>>
<DIV></DIV>>I think I have spent 3000.00 in the
last 7 years on my
<DIV></DIV>>minis.
<DIV></DIV>>
<DIV></DIV>>Even 20 per month I could tolerate but
anything above
<DIV></DIV>>that would be pushing it.
<DIV></DIV>>
<DIV></DIV>>I am a Network Systems guy so I know
what it takes to
<DIV></DIV>>make this game run and be stable, let
alone program
<DIV></DIV>>the thing.
<DIV></DIV>>
<DIV></DIV>>Giving us a better product comes with a
small price I
<DIV></DIV>>guess.
<DIV></DIV>>
<DIV></DIV>>I think the 12 is fair.
<DIV></DIV>>
<DIV></DIV>>2 cents............
<DIV></DIV>>
<DIV></DIV>>--- mlockridge01
<MLOCKRIDGE01@...>wrote:
<DIV></DIV>> > My previous post touched on this.
I have thought
<DIV></DIV>> > about it a bit. We
<DIV></DIV>> > pay less than $200 a year just to
play. Not bad. I
<DIV></DIV>> > spent at least
<DIV></DIV>> > $500 on GamesWorkshop products
each year when I was
<DIV></DIV>> > more active
<DIV></DIV>> > there.
<DIV></DIV>> >
<DIV></DIV>> > I don't have a problem dropping
the monthly fee. It
<DIV></DIV>> > is quite
<DIV></DIV>> > reasonable. I might be able to
dump another $500 a
<DIV></DIV>> > year into
<DIV></DIV>> > upgrades. Unfortunately, my
machine is now pretty
<DIV></DIV>> > much maxed. So I
<DIV></DIV>> > must hope that I can hold out at
the present level
<DIV></DIV>> > long enough to get
<DIV></DIV>> > together the funds for a more
upgradeable tower.
<DIV></DIV>> >
<DIV></DIV>> > How much are others willing to
pay to play?
<DIV></DIV>> >
<DIV></DIV>> > Barto Proudfoot
<DIV></DIV>> >
<DIV></DIV>> >
